f4cc1084-4dc5-4254-aa7e-4479dbf37ad3.description: The badge earner is a Member of International Coaching Federation Professional Coaches, the leading global organization dedicated to advancing the coaching profession by setting high standards. As an ICF Member, the badge earner is enrolled in an accredited coach training program or has completed 60 hours of training aligned with ICF standards, and commits to abiding by the ICF Code of Ethics.
f4cc1084-4dc5-4254-aa7e-4479dbf37ad3.name: ICF Member Badge

badge_template_activities.title: To qualify for ICF Membership, an individual must hold a current ICF Credential (ACC, PCC, or MCC); have completed at least 60 hours of coach-specific training that meets ICF standards; OR be enrolled in 60 hours of coach-specific training in a program that has either the ICF Accredited Coach Training Program (ACTP) or Approved Coach-Specific Training Hours (ACSTH) distinction. ICF Members also commit to abide by the ICF Code of Ethics.

63773db3-75a6-432f-93f4-5ac41aa47df4.description: Associate Certified Coach (ACC) Credential-holders are trained (60+ hours) and experienced (100+ hours) coaches. They have demonstrated knowledge and emerging proficiency in the application of the ICF Core Competencies, Code of Ethics, and definition of coaching. Earners show a commitment to high ethical standards and have demonstrated, through rigorous assessment, professional competence in their work with clients. The ACC must be renewed every three years.
63773db3-75a6-432f-93f4-5ac41aa47df4.name: Associate Certified Coach (ACC)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF core coaching competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coach Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The Code of Ethics is designed to provide appropriate guidelines, accountability and enforceable standards of conduct for all ICF Members and ICF Credential-holders, who commit to abiding by the ICF Code of Ethics.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of at least 60 hours of coach-specific training that meets ICF guidelines for credentialing.
Completion of at least 100 hours of client-coaching experience since the start of their coach training.
Completion of 10 hours of mentor coaching with an eligible mentor coach.
Submission of a completed application for the Associate Certified Coach Credential.
Pass both knowledge and performance assessments at the Associate Certified Coach level.

fec6eab5-2a26-4cd8-965c-b139f34bf08c.description: Professional Certified Coach (PCC) Credential-holders are trained (125+ hours), experienced (500+ hours) coaches. They have demonstrated knowledge and proficient application of the ICF Core Competencies, Code of Ethics, and definition of coaching. Earners show a commitment to high ethical standards and have demonstrated, through rigorous assessment, competence in using a variety of behaviors and skills in their work with clients. The PCC must be renewed every three years.
fec6eab5-2a26-4cd8-965c-b139f34bf08c.name: Professional Certified Coach (PCC)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF core coaching competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coach Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The Code of Ethics is designed to provide appropriate guidelines, accountability and enforceable standards of conduct for all ICF Members and ICF Credential-holders, who commit to abiding by the ICF Code of Ethics.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of at least 125 hours of coach-specific training that meets ICF guidelines for credentialing.
Completion of at least 500 hours of client-coaching experience since the start of their coach training.
Completion of 10 hours of mentor coaching with an eligible mentor coach.
Submission of a completed application for the Professional Certified Coach Credential.
Pass both knowledge and performance assessments at the Professional Certified Coach level.

252319e9-bcef-47e0-8e21-bc6c6c5b3694.description: Master Certified Coach (MCC) Credential-holders are highly trained (200+ hours) and experienced (2,500+ hours) coaches. They have demonstrated knowledge and highly proficient application of the ICF Core Competencies, Code of Ethics, and definition of coaching. Earners show a commitment to high ethical standards and have demonstrated, through rigorous assessment, a high degree of competence and fluency in a variety of skills in their work with clients. The MCC must be renewed every three years.
252319e9-bcef-47e0-8e21-bc6c6c5b3694.name: Master Certified Coach (MCC)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF core coaching competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coach Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The Code of Ethics is designed to provide appropriate guidelines, accountability and enforceable standards of conduct for all ICF Members and ICF Credential-holders, who commit to abiding by the ICF Code of Ethics.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of at least 200 hours of coach-specific training that meets ICF guidelines for credentialing.
Completion of at least 2,500 hours of client-coaching experience since the start of their coach training.
Completion of 10 hours of mentor coaching with an eligible mentor coach.
Submission of a completed application for the Master Certified Coach Credential.
Pass both knowledge and performance assessments at the Master Certified Coach level.
Hold or have previously held a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential.

18be1ab8-28a6-43ac-a73a-3c0fe9ad65fa.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated advanced coaching knowledge, skill and competence in the area of team coaching, in alignment with the ICF Team Coaching Competencies. An ICF ACTC holder has met rigorous requirements for team coaching education and experience, engages in guided reflective practice and has passed an independent team coaching certification exam. The earner is among the world's first to earn the ICF ACTC, as a participant in the ICF ACTC Operational Pilot program.
18be1ab8-28a6-43ac-a73a-3c0fe9ad65fa.name: ICF Advanced Certification in Team Coaching (ACTC) Operational Pilot

alignments.name: ICF Team Coaching Competencies
alignments.description: ICF’s Team Coaching Competencies describe the knowledge and skills a professional coach must have to effectively engage in team coaching. The ICF Team Coaching Competencies are designed to integrate with the ICF Core Competencies, which provide the foundation for all coaching practice.

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coaching Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The ICF Code of Ethics describes the ICF core values, ethical principles and ethical standards of behavior for all ICF Professionals.

badge_template_activities.title: Hold an active ICF Credential in good standing at the Associate Certified Coach (ACC), Professional Certified Coach (PCC) or Master Certified Coach (MCC) level.
Demonstrate completion of at least 60 hours of team coaching education or training.
Demonstrate completion of at least 10 team coaching engagements.
Complete a minimum of 10 hours of guided reflective practice with an eligible coaching supervisor or mentor coach trained in coaching supervision.
Submit a completed application for the ICF Advanced Certification in Team Coaching.

Successfully pass the ICF Advanced Certification in Team Coaching exam, a comprehensive test that measures a candidate's knowledge of and ability to apply the ICF Team Coaching Competencies in practice.

3cfae8e9-74b7-4bf3-a16a-e015d7cd18a1.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated advanced coaching knowledge, skill and competence in the discipline of team coaching, in alignment with the ICF Team Coaching Competencies. An ICF ACTC holder has met rigorous requirements for team coaching education and experience, engages in guided reflective practice and has passed an independent team coaching certification exam.
3cfae8e9-74b7-4bf3-a16a-e015d7cd18a1.name: ICF Advanced Certification in Team Coaching (ACTC)

alignments.name: ICF Team Coaching Competencies
alignments.description: ICF’s Team Coaching Competencies describe the knowledge and skills a professional coach must have to effectively engage in team coaching. The ICF Team Coaching Competencies are designed to integrate with the ICF Core Competencies, which provide the foundation for all coaching practice.

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support a greater understanding of the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by the International Coaching Federation.

alignments.name: ICF Code of Ethics
alignments.description: The ICF Code of Ethics describes the ICF core values, ethical principles and ethical standards of behavior for all ICF Professionals.

badge_template_activities.title: Hold an active ICF Credential in good standing at the Associate Certified Coach (ACC), Professional Certified Coach (PCC) or Master Certified Coach (MCC) level.
Demonstrate completion of at least 60 hours of team coaching education or training.
Demonstrate completion of at least five (5) team coaching engagements.
Complete a minimum of five (5) hours of guided reflective practice with an eligible coaching supervisor or mentor coach trained in coaching supervision.
Submit a completed application for the ICF Advanced Certification in Team Coaching.
Successfully pass the ICF Team Coaching Certification exam, a comprehensive test that measures a candidate's knowledge of the ICF Team Coaching Competencies and proficiency in team coaching practice.
